fields.description:
Hello,

I would like to be able to fork repositories using API v2, which seems doesn't to be supported.

As a workaround, I'm using the V1 api which works fine. Can we have this functionality to API v2?
fields.summary: Fork repositories using  Bitbucket API v2

fields.description:
In the merge conditions for a repository it would be useful to have an option to require that a branch be fast-forwardable from the source branch (usually master) before allowing it to be merged.

The use-case for this is that branches can be mergeable (ie. no source-code conflicts) but still have semantic conflicts due to commits in master that are ahead of the branch to be merged.

(This has happened in a production code-base of ours where the branch pipeline has passed, but on merge causes master to fail - with genuine errors in the application that would have caused an outage had it been deployed).
fields.summary: Add Fast-Forward Merge Condition

fields.description:
when adding header in markdown syntax in file README.md, the browse page doesn't display heading line under the header.

For example, when adding {{# header 1}} it displays:

h1. header 1
while it is supposed to display

h1. header 1
----
fields.summary: header in markdown syntax doesn't display heading line

fields.description:
My pipeline conguration look like this

{code}
#!javascript

# You can use any Docker image from Docker Hub or your own container registry
image: node:6.9.4
image: spittet/node-mongodb
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        script:  # Modify the commands below to build and test your repository.
          - apt-get update
          - apt-get install -y ruby libssl-dev
          - gem install sass
          - node -v
          - npm --version
{code}
fields.summary: nodejs version still comes to 4.6.0 though i am using 6.9.4

fields.description: Please add functionality to export all the Audit Logs to PDF/XLSX/CSV formats
fields.summary: Ability to export audit logs

fields.description:
Upgrading GIT to 2.16.2 will allow 2 advantages (there are others - see release notes):

# Uploading or fetching a large # of tags in a commit is substantially quicker.
# 2.x and later support the --shallow-since CLONE option:

{code}
#!python

$ git clone https://my-repo --shallow-since="2016-10-01"
Cloning into 'myrepo'...
fatal: Server does not support --shallow-since
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
{code}

Git release notes for 2.16:\\
https://github.com/git/git/blob/master/Documentation/RelNotes/2.16.0.txt\\
https://github.com/git/git/blob/master/Documentation/RelNotes/2.16.1.txt\\
https://github.com/git/git/blob/v2.16.2/Documentation/RelNotes/2.16.2.txt
fields.summary: Upgrade Git to 2.21.0

fields.description:
This issue first started yesterday, I noticed it on my mobile browser, thought it's a resizing issue. Logged in to bitbucket this morning and noticed that all the titles of pull requests that have emojis in them are not displaying: instead only first emoji is displayed, and it is centered inside the title box.

It's very hard to navigate without titles.\\
!1379614204-emojititle.jpg|thumbnail!\\
!3868662498-emoji%202.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Title of Pull Request not displaying if contains emoji

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm running into the following problem which seems to be local to my environment (I tested cloning the repo from a different environment and it worked). Does anyone have any idea what could be causing this error? I'm really kind of struggling with that one.

{code}
#!shell

D:\somefolder\Scripts>git clone https://myusername@bitbucket.org/myusername/myrepo.git -v
Cloning into 'myrepo'...
* Couldn't find host bitbucket.org in the _netrc file; using defaults
* timeout on name lookup is not supported
*   Trying 104.192.143.1...
* TCP_NODELAY set
* Connected to bitbucket.org (104.192.143.1) port 443 (#0)
* ALPN, offering http/1.1
* Cipher selection: ALL:!EXPORT:!EXPORT40:!EXPORT56:!aNULL:!LOW:!RC4:@STRENGTH
* successfully set certificate verify locations:
*   CAfile: D:/Program Files/Git/mingw64/ssl/certs/ca-bundle.crt
  CApath: none
* OpenSSL SSL_connect: SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL in connection to bitbucket.org:443
* stopped the pause stream!
* Closing connection 0
fatal: unable to access 'https://myusername@bitbucket.org/myusername/myrepo.git': OpenSSL SSL_connect: SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL in connection to bitbucket.org:443

{code}
fields.summary: OpenSSL SSL_connect: SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL in connection to bitbucket.org:443

fields.description:
Issue BCLOUD-14404 - I've added a comment to the closed issue with an example where issue still occurs.

Please reopen that issue.
fields.summary: Issue reported as resolved still not working

fields.description: It would be nice to have a feature whereby email notification could be sent to the same user who triggered and event such as commit. Users could also be give the option to enable/disable this feature.
fields.summary: Email Notifications for the events triggered by the same user

fields.description:
In the billing details page (https://bitbucket.org/account/user/your_username/billing-details), there's a typo:

"Charges will originate from our principal place of business: Atlassian Pty Ltd (Level 6, 341 George St, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia). Your billing statement may display Atlassian B.V., located in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Your credit card issuer may charge foreign transaction or cross-border fees in addition to the *toal* price above."

It should be "total"
fields.summary: A typo in the billing details page

fields.description:
When a user is a Team admin and goes to create a new Users Group on the team account and then tries to add their own user to the group, there is no indication against their Name/UserName that they are adding themselves.\\
It's not very user friendly and confusing .\\
Can we please add an indication against the user name that displays them as either a

* Teammate\\
or
* Says "Current user "\\
so that they know exactly who they are adding to the group.
fields.summary: When user is adding himself to a group on a team account - the user doesn't have any indication it's them

fields.description:
When create a pull request, from folk repo to origin repo, if the branch not exist in the origin repo, it will appear in the target branch drop down list as BranchName (new branch).

Previously you can create a pull request and will create a new branch in the origin repo when approved.

But now it doesn't work anymore.  Error message shows as below and stops creating the PR.\\
The following error(s) occurred saving this pull request\\
Invalid destination branch
fields.summary: Cannot create pull request from folk repo to origin repo with "(new branch)"

fields.description:
For example, if you have created the branch name as "*develop/test*" , you are not able to create the branch "*develop*".

!338415355-Pasted_Image_15_06_2017__5_40_PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Creating a branch name results "Invalid branch name." if branch name appears as parent directory
Support markdown image resize

fields.description: If I have been added directly to a repo, I can leave it via the "revoke" link. If I have been added via a group, that "revoke" link doesn't exist. How do I leave a repo?
fields.summary: Leave A Repo That I Was Added To Via A Group

fields.description:
I realize that code search is in BETA, but I wanted to bring to your attention that searching for something like "$name" does not work.  The symbol is ignored and search results include every occurrence of "name".  I've tried several ways of escaping the dollar sign to no avail.

There is not yet a Component to choose for search, so cataloging under "Usability"
fields.summary: Dollar sign in search

fields.description:
Occasionally, a commit does not start a pipeline build.

(Example: clicking "Sync now" on a branch does not start a pipeline build, but I have seen more causes).

In this case, I would still like to be able to manually start the build.
fields.summary: Allow "Run pipeline" to start default pipeline build.

fields.description:
As we are a big team and sometimes mistakes can cause repos to jump in size (and approaching the limits) we would like to monitor how the size of a repo is progressing and that would be a great addition to Bitbucket Cloud.\\
We are currently doing this outside Bitbucket but it would be easier if it was integrated within Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: Add a graphical illustration of a repo size progression from date of creation

fields.description:
The Code Blocks set in the Read Me file, when viewed from Repository Overview is not showing properly.

The code block is not wrapping but instead it's showing all in one line.

It's preferred to have these lines wrapped.
fields.summary: Code Blocks in Repository Overview are not wrapping

fields.description:
Hello,

So the recent change to address the issue of committing via the rest api  (BCLOUD-8672) is awesome. However it doesn't seem like there is the ability to push commits to branches other than what is specified as the main branch.

Could support for this be added?
fields.summary: Committing to other branches via the REST api

fields.description: Can we have support for rmarkdown files to display on the bitbucket repository overview page?
fields.summary: Rmarkdown support for bitbucket overview

fields.description:
So:

# I start creating pull request
# Then pushed some changes to destination branch of my PR
# Press create a pull request button
# Nothing Happens ;(

The Network tab shows me and error that destination branch was changed(error: 'The branch develop (c79daaebeee6) may have changed. Refresh your page to get updated branch information.') But this error is not shown for the user.
fields.summary: No error shown for the user when creating pull request and push changes to dependant branch
Allow customization of Slack messages for Pipeline builds

fields.description: Is there a possibility to create an "All Commits" tab at overview page containing all commits history of the user describing his contribution by date?
fields.summary: Add user's "All Commits" tab on overview page

fields.description: Understand that BitBucket Cloud is not having encryption at rest by default. Please explore the option of encrypting the data.
fields.summary: Support encryption at rest

fields.description:
One of the things I love about Bitbucket is it's great support for Mercurial.

However, I find it really frustrating that when I am adding new repos, I have to always click Mercurial as the type, instead of GIT which is the default. There should be an option in my settings to select what my preferred default is. I don't use GIT much, and when I do, I am often on github anyway.

I hope you'll address this because many times I created like 10 repos not paying attention that it created git repos, and I had to go delete them and start again. Annoying.

Thanks for your great serivce, I hope you can address this.
fields.summary: Need a way to default the Repo type to Mercurial

fields.description: Getting the following error while trying to make change: "We had trouble committing your changes."
fields.summary: CAN'T COMMIT ANY CHANGES!

fields.description:
Firefox running in "safe" mode, without add-ons. Occurs in every line, where there are tabs in begining of the line.\\
!1574094889-ScreenClip.png|thumbnail!\\
!3092583012-ScreenClip.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Tabulation is absent in Firefox 53.0.3

fields.description: The first repository listed under Team Settings > User groups > [any group name] > Repositories is centered aligned, instead of left aligned. All subsequent repositories are left aligned.
fields.summary: Team Settings - User Group Repository List - Text Alignment of First Repo Is Incorrect (BBCDEV-7352)

fields.description:
The Settings link changes based on context (Team, repo, account view)

Let's consider describing the actual menu, rather than having a 'Settings' for each, or create additional menus that change either team, user, repository, Atlassian account settings
fields.summary: Settings link is inconsistent

fields.description:
Currently, there are quite a few clicks before you get to user access / group settings:

1): Go to a single repository, select Settings, Go to User and group access, add an e-mail address / username, then add the permission

2): Select profile (bottom left), select team name, go to Settings, select User groups, add e-mail address to a group, assign permission here OR assign permission through the repository menu found in 1)

Seems our permission setups are unnecessarily obfuscated in our platform -- we should place it in more areas (such as the members screen) or in the main sidebar
fields.summary: Improve location of user access / group permissions

fields.description:
When you approve a Pull request you have to refresh the current page (hit F5) or Bitbucket refuse to merge.\\
You can see the approval but without a manual refresh it won't work.

Setup of the branch : Check for at least 1 approval\\
!2758905444-merge_check_error.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cannot approve and merge a pull request if the merge check is "on"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With merge check option selected, user with "Merge via pull request" or "Write access" are still able to merge the Pull Request without fulfilling the merge check requirement

###Steps to Reproduce

# Setup a PR to merge from Branch A to master
# With Branch permission set as below:
# Click *Merge* on the PR

Branch Permission Settings:

{code}
#!python
Branch: master
Write access: Only myself
Merge via pull request: Everybody
Merge checks: Check for at least 1 approval.
{code}

###Expected Results\\
Not allow user to merge the PR until the merge requirement is fulfill

###Actual current Results\\
User manages to merge the PR without fulfilling the merge requirement.

!2469262838-MergeCheck.gif|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Merge Check doesn't work accordingly

fields.description: This allows for ease of navigation instead of requiring the user to open the specific pull request page.
fields.summary: Include JIRA issue ID as a link in the pull requests initial page

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a Mercurial repository
# Create a README.md
# Commit
# Edit README.md using the online editor
# Change 1 character
# Click on _View Diff_ in the editor

The diff would show that all lines are removed. However, this does not reflect the actual commit done and is purely a UI issue.
fields.summary: "View Diff" on online editor shows all lines are removed for Mercurial repositories (BBCDEV-7363)

fields.description: As an admin, I would like to define the threshold for pipelines build minutes to prevent never-ending builds, consuming build minute quota given to the team.
fields.summary: Allow admins to set pipelines build minute threshold

fields.description: The new login system in its current state is not friendly for people having more than 1 account, e.g. using a work email address and a private one, as account switching requires logout and then logging back in with the other account. Being able to login into both accounts and then switch the context would improve usability.
fields.summary: Possibility to switch between accounts without logout

fields.description:
Even though i setup branch permissions (and users can't directly commit+push to the master branch) on my repository, users can still create a pull request to their task-branch, and merge it themselves

this means they can commit+push changes to the branch i'm trying to protect as an admin
fields.summary: Pull requests - users without permissions to write to branch X can merge tasks to it

fields.description:
Please could we add the issue status to "issue updated" webhook? This would allow non-BB users to see how/if an issue was resolved.

Similar to BCLOUD-13943.
fields.summary: Add issue status to "issue updated" webhook

fields.description:
This has been asked and answered in Community Support over here:

* https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Enable-SAML/qaq-p/61018

I am opening a ticket here for tracking purposes.
fields.summary: Support SAML for Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
In the new Bitbucket UI, a new repository created with a resized window shows that part of the page hides behind the Navigation Bar.

Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new repository.
# Adjust the browser window's width.
# Verify that this content isn't correctly displaying

!530813721-123.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Repository blank state contents hidden under sidebar when window is resized (BBCDEV-7338)

fields.description:
The current branch overview in Bitbucket is confusing as compared to how it was being displayed in SourceTree. (see image below)

It'd be great if each branches are consistently displayed by indent with the same colour.
fields.summary: Make Bitbucket's branch tree more consistent with Sourcetree's

fields.description:
Checking the users listed at the URL https://bitbucket.org/account/user/user_name_or_team_name/plan-users/ for a personal account or a team account, we would like to be able to:
* See the last time that they did log in
* See their activity which would include:
** The Pull Requests that they Approved/Merged
** The commits that they did
** The pages that they accessed (including wikis, issues, and settings).

We believe that this would help us a lot to properly identify: :
# The users that are inactive 
# The users that are active and their usage
# When the users were removed/added
# What changes did the users do during a given period
fields.summary: Display last access date for plan users

fields.description:
'm attempting to create a repository.\\
Page: https://bitbucket.org/repo/create\\
After filling in the Name, Description, Language, etc, the "Create repository" button is greyed out.

I am using Safari Version 9.1.2 (11601.7.7)
fields.summary: "create repository" button disabled

fields.description:
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/hooks

Spec needs to be updated to show the skip cert validation option.
fields.summary: API 2 documentation for webhooks does not show skip cert validation option. (BBD-475)

fields.description:
We are experimenting with BitBucket Pipelines to replace our current build server. When we run PHPUnit, the Pipelines output turns the filenames in the errors into direct links to sourcefiles in the repository. These links currently don't work because the line numbers are appended to the URL.

Example with 404:\\
https://bitbucket.org/rrudnicki/site2/src/8885173f243c44014472add287271fe57f2812a3/src/Brick/test.php:87\

Correct link (removed to :87):\\
https://bitbucket.org/rrudnicki/site2/src/8885173f243c44014472add287271fe57f2812a3/src/Brick/test.php
fields.summary: Linking to the sourcecode in Pipelines output give 404 (BBCI-4716)

fields.description: I want to use a postgres docker service as part of my Pipelines. However, I also need to run custom commands/configuration on this service. There looks to be no way to run commands on service containers
fields.summary: Run custom commands in a service container

fields.description:
Currently, there is 2 pages to track users in a team:

# Users on plan shows any user that is counted towards the plan. This does not include users that have been added into a group but have no permission towards any team private repo.
# Groups page. The groups page shows a list of groups. This does not include users that have been granted access to the repository directly.

When a team member leaves the company, the administrator will need to check 2 pages to remove the team member. It's also tedious to check the groups as there is no unified view of all group members.

To ease the process, Bitbucket should have a page showing a list of group members in all groups so users can easily search and remove users
fields.summary: Consolidated view of group members in a team

fields.description: We are using Pipelines for two repositories. This morning Pipelines got stuck at the "Starting agent..." step. Now, Pipelines has been disabled for both repositories but we haven't changed any of the settings.
fields.summary: Pipelines disabled

fields.description:
With the new Bitbucket UI, on the Import Page it appears to be that the line which allows users to collapse the Navigation Bar still exist despite the the actual Bar not being visible. As shown in the image below :

!494475489-123.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Part of Navigation Bar still visible on Import Repository page (BBCDEV-7332)

fields.description:
When the parser encounters a back tic character (`), it correctly interprets it as a string. However when the closing back tic is preceded by a closing curly brace, }, it seems to fail to recognize the closing of the string, thus the remainder of the file is highlighted as though it is a single massive string.

This is a common occurrence due to ES2015 + spec for template strings which use variable notation as {{${myVar}}}
fields.summary: Javascript syntax highlighting broken with back tic `

fields.description:
This would be immensely useful for lerna repos for example where they have the following structure.

{code}
root/
  node_modules/
  packages/
    package-a/
      node_modules/
   package-b/
      node_modules/
   package-c/
      node_modules/
   ...
{code}

So we'd really like to be able to do something like

{code}
definitions:
  caches:
    lerna: packages/*/node_modules
  
{code}
fields.summary: Allow Pipelines caching using a pattern rather than hardcoded directories

fields.description: No syntax highlighting for files with '.r' suffix.
fields.summary: Syntax highlighting for R files

fields.summary: Web client throws console error and can't use repo (new UI)
Customer Request: Ability to create a fork through API where the owner of the new repository is a team account.
Update Bitbucket API documentation to allow redirects from response 302

fields.description:
Previously reported instances of this issue don't seem to have been addressed: BCLOUD-3922

The problem just popped up on one of our pull requests and it makes large Bitbucket pull requests completely unuseable.

The attached image is an example of what I'm seeing, except its on almost all the files in the PR.  I'm not sure if it has something to do with the new Bitbucket UI or not, but it seems to happen after a certain size in the PR.  Reminds me of the old UI and how Bitbucket would only load a certain number of files in a large PR, except before you could manually load them as you needed to.  Now they just incorrectly say "File contents unchanged."
fields.summary: "File contents unchanged" while the raw commit has changes

fields.description:
users will not see navigation panel on the left in the new interface for some repo pages\\
See screen shot attached for example
fields.summary: Repo Navigation doesn't render on some pages (BBCDEV-7284)

fields.description: Hit Create Pull Request button with all data there, ajax spinner starts and very quickly stops and then I see an error in Chrome dev tools. This happens sporadically. See attached image.
fields.summary: Pull requests sporadically can't be created. Timeout?

fields.description: At least I can't seem to find it.
fields.summary: Fork feature not available from new nav

fields.description:
Behavior in GIT:\\
user A codes and creates a pull request\\
user B reviews and clicks merge\\
-> generates a new merge-commit from user A

Behavior in Mercurial\\
user A codes and creates a pull request\\
user B reviews and clicks merge\\
-> generates a new merge-commit from user B

The correct behavior should be the Mercurial one-- however, we are showing the wrong person when the user clicks 'Merge' for Git.

PR notification emails report incorrect users as well
fields.summary: Author of merge commit from a pull request is inconsistent between Git & Hg

fields.description:
The UI to get emails when commits are pushed does not appear on the admin interface until code has been pushed to the repo.

I set up repos for other people to use, and I wish I could set up subscriptions when I create the repo, before anything is pushed to it.
fields.summary: Subscribing to notifications at repo creation

fields.description: When viewing Source in Chrome or MS Edge, it appears that the line with the comments and more than one JIRA message in brackets is cut in half
fields.summary: In source view, JIRA issues and text are cut off

fields.description:
customers will see no change in LFS usage on account after they have either deleted the repo with large LFS or transferred it to a different account.\\
The calculations of LFS usage per account needs to change according to the exact usage once the changes are made on account
fields.summary: LFS usage per account doesn't get updated once the repo with LFS is deleted

fields.description: Just notice that one of our builds was waiting for over 15 hours.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipeline stuck for over 2 hours saving logs

fields.description: If the PR contains multiple commits, bitbucket currently uses the branch name to pre-fill the Title field. This leads to poor titles in many PRs for us, because branches may have names such as feature/<jira-issue-key>-<very-short-desc>. It is very easy for developers to forget to give their PRs good titles this way.
fields.summary: Improve prefilled title from branch name when creating multi-commit pull request

fields.description:
I have started receiving this error from last 2 days when I pust my changes into Bitbucket for 2 of my repositories.

Error - 'https://ravikanasagra1@bitbucket.org/xxx/xxx.git/': The requested URL returned error: 403

I have tried pushing my code from Source Tree and using android studio. From both places I have received error.

!1795681853-NewRepoError-SourceTree.JPG|thumbnail!

!244888100-PushErrorAndroidStudio.JPG|thumbnail!

when I start my android studio, from last 2 days I am getting certificate error too. Below is the error pop which I have to accept.!1739413042-SourceTree_CertError.JPG|thumbnail!

My team is also receiving this same behavior. If anyone encountered this error and found fix. Kindly share.
fields.summary: Bitbucket code push error

fields.description: Not sure if I'm doing something wrong but everytime I try to create a repo, when I press the 'Create repository' button it seems to do something (browser loading something) but then I just stay on the same screen. Is my account locked out or something?
fields.summary: Cannot create a repo

fields.description:
For a test pipeline which runs multiple tests that are independent of each other it would shorten the feedback loop to run them in parallel.

{code}
#!yml

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        parallel: true # for example
        script:
          - test/client.sh
          - test/server.sh
          - test/other.sh
{code}

This could be achieved currently by writing a master script that starts the other ones but it would make a mess of all the outputs which are currently cleanly separated in pipelines.

Ideally as soon as one fails it would fail the built early.
fields.summary: Allow optional concurent/parallel script execution in Pipelines

fields.description: As you can see the right side of the sided by side diff in pull request page doesnot render at all for me. I am working on ubuntu 16.04 using Chrome browser.
fields.summary: Side by side Diff not loading the current branch page

fields.description:
Every time i try to log into my repository I get a 505 error\\
Here is the code: e5b55b27a7d1485aac868de034acbb32
fields.summary: Repository login error

fields.description:
List User Groups alphabetically after the Administrators group. Currently, the Administrators group is listed first, but it is not clear what the sorting order is for the rest of the user groups. See attached screenshot.

Steps to Reproduce

# Go to Team Settings.
# Click on User groups.
fields.summary: List User Groups Aphabetically After Administrators

fields.description:
I've encountered an issue with merging a pull request. I'm using a Mercurial repository.

A pull request was created for branch {{x}} and was to be merged into branch {{y}} (destination branch). After creating the PR branch {{y}} was merged (into {{default}}) and closed. I did not know that and clicked on "Merge" button on the PR's page. After I accepted the merge message the loading icon started spinning and was spinning, and spinning... After about 30 seconds I refreshed the page and did the same thing -- to the same effect. It turned out that:

* The {{x}} branch has been closed, but not merged.
* The PR was still in "open" state. When I clicked on "Edit" button to change destination branch the edit page only loaded partially: there was spinning loading icon under "Update pull request" button and list of commits didn't load.

Finally, I declined PR and merged the {{x}} branch manually to the correct branch ({{default}}). It worked correctly, as expected.
fields.summary: Possible pull request merging bug (Mercurial)

fields.description:
Currently, there is no option for a user to change the primary email address. Changing the primary email address also should automatically switch the Atlassian Account it is linked to.

The only workaround right now is to create a support ticket to get it switched.
fields.summary: Option to change primary email address in Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
Currently, each files in Bitbucket are linked using:\\
https://bitbucket.org/username/repository/src/<revision hash>/<filename>/?at=<branch name>

Instead of linking to a specific commit hash, the source view should link to the head of the branch directly unless a specific commit was selected.

Example, the URL could be:\\
https://bitbucket.org/username/repository/src/<filename>/?at=<branch name>
fields.summary: URL shortcuts to head of branch when viewing files on the Bitbucket UI

fields.description: We want to be able to create private comments that can only be seen by the users that have access to our team/repositories into our public _Issue Tracker_ issues.
fields.summary: Private issue comments

fields.description:
Would be possible to see a list of log in dates on Audit Log? Something like this:

User Last Login\\
Joe 5/26/17 8:00 AM\\
Bob 5/24/17 2:00 PM\\
Sally 3/23/17 9:00 PM

In addition, when user is removed from the team account, we create an entry in Audit log that the user was removed.  However when the user is added again directly to the repository , there is no entry for this in Audit log and this makes things confusing for Audit purposes, when we only see Removed but never see the entry Added.\\
Please add the entry to Audit log when Access Granted to the repo directly - since the user is visible under Users on Plan again under team account.
fields.summary: Include "last access" or "last login" dates in audit log along with entry when user was added to the Repository access

fields.description: Please add the feature to bind a branch to an issue of the built-in issue tracker. Moreover, please add a check to force (or not) whether branches can only be created with a related issue.
fields.summary: Link branch with issue

fields.description:
bq. When someone requests transfer of his own private repo to the organization, the administrator of the organization cannot view contents of the repository, which requires the administrator to:

* request for access to repository (which has much less security impact than transfer of the ownership),
* Communication with repository author,
* blind acceptance of the repo ownership.
fields.summary: Ability to view the private repository before accepting the repository transfer

fields.description:
In the Commits Tab, using browser back button causes the commit tree to be located at the bottom of the page.

_Steps to Reproduce the Bug_

# Navigate to Commits in a repository
# At the end of the commit page click Next to navigate to the next page of commits
# Click the back button on the browser to go back to the first page of commits.
# Look at the location of the commit tree which will then be located at the bottom of the\\
page below the commit table.
fields.summary: Commit Tree shown at bottom of the page when browser back button is clicked on commit page

fields.description:
Device: iPad

Safari:

!4265838120-image.png|thumbnail!

Chrome:

!66095502-image.png|thumbnail!

Firefox:

!3727658697-image.png|thumbnail!

The problem is that on the iPad, all non-safari browsers use the Safari engine, so the problem persists in Chrome & Firefox.

I cannot navigate anywhere within BitBucket. This new navigational system, has destroyed vital, core functionality, to the point, where I cannot use BitBucket, at all!
fields.summary: Side menu is redundant on Safari 9

fields.description: Websites would be a lot more amazing if htaccess is enabled. Besides adding a pass-code protection, htaccess could also be used for browser caching which would make your website loads faster.
fields.summary: Enable htaccess for hosted websites

fields.description:
From what I can see it's only possible to run a custom pipeline from the "Commit" page. I'm currently using custom Pipelines to trigger deployments to environments. I have a custom pipeline config that looks as follows:

{code}
pipelines:
  custom:
    2-uat:
      - step:
          script:
            - lein eb deploy uat 1.0-$BITBUCKET_COMMIT
    3-prod:
      - step:
          script:
            - lein eb deploy www 1.0-$BITBUCKET_COMMIT
{code}

Adding it to the build results page would make it easier to promote to another environment.

Could be as simple as adding the link in red to the detailed build results page:

!1673097645-Screen%20Shot%202017-05-26%20at%2010.10.58.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add the ability to run a new pipeline on-demand.

fields.description:
It will be best to have a page in Account Settings to show which premium feature that the account is using.

For instance, user unable to identify which repositories are enabled with the "Merge Checks" feature.\\
The only workaround, for now, is to navigate to each repository settings to review the settings.

This will greatly help users to manage their account's plan.
fields.summary: Ability to check which premium features are enabled in Account Settings

fields.description:
There's a bug with the Repository Overview Layout when there's a block with a long line in the READ ME file. The contents are pushed below the Navbar.

!4152039390-123.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Layout broken when README contains a block with long line

fields.description:
##Summary##

Issue occurring with the alignment of the first repo in new UI.

!3247868968-Screen%20Shot%202017-05-25%20at%205.42.01%20PM.png|thumbnail!

##Steps to Reproduce##

* Navigate to Team's page
* Select _Settings_
* Click _User Groups_ > Select any group
* Click on tab _Repositories_

Issue reproducible on latest versions of Safari, Chrome, and Firefox.
fields.summary: Repository avatar is misaligned on group settings page

fields.description:
We have had a few reports that the side bar for the Forked repo with the option "Sync now" with the parent repo is not visible in the UI when the README contains a block with a long line.

Workaround for it is:\\
you can work around the bug by splitting long lines into multiple in the code blocks of README — the sidebar will re-appear after that
fields.summary: Long lines in README hides "Sync now" button on a forked repo (BBCDEV-7176)

fields.description: In case someone send an invite to a alias email, could that notification also to be sent to the primary email? If not, can we block users to invite others using their alias email?
fields.summary: Email Aliases Cannot Accept Invitations

fields.description: I have set some environment variables for Pipeline but in the build they are ignored and instead of using the value of the variable the build uses the original text, eg. "$USERNAME" instead of "myuser". And of course the build fails. Using only Non-Secured Environment variables seem to "fix" this issue. Although it seems to make the whole concept of Secured Environment variable pointless. Are there any plans on fixing this issue properly in the future?
fields.summary: Pipeline ignores environment variables

fields.description:
We'd like to use bitbucket pipelines, but we require the multistage build feature introduced in docker 17.05. Unfortunately the version reported in bitbucket pipeline is from the 1.12 series, which is now almost a year old.

Is there a way by which we can run a newer version of docker for our pipelines or is there a timeline for when bitbucket pipeline's version of docker will be updated to a more current one?
fields.summary: Upgrade Docker for multi-stage builds (v17.05+)

fields.description:
We are paying Indian service tax ,please provide us service tax registration certificate.\\
And please specify the steps for refunding.
fields.summary: Service TAX

fields.description:
*Scenario*\\
You have restrictions set on PR merging, for example at least 1 approval is needed by someone else before it can be merged.

*Problem*\\
If you approve someone else's PR you can't merge the PR because the page says that you still need at least one approval, refreshing the page fixes the issue.

*Expected*\\
After approving someones PR, then the Merge button should turn blue immediately and you can merge it straight away.

This used to work but stopped working around 4 days ago or so.

Using new UI.
fields.summary: Can't merge PR right away after approving if approval is required

fields.description:
In the new UI of Bitbucket, click create a new branch the dialog had overlapping forms and Branch From field was stuck at label "Loading"

Steps to produce the bug:

# Go to Branches tab. by default Active tab is selected.
# Click on Merged tab.
# Click on Active tab.
# Click on Create Branch.
fields.summary: Create Branch dialog shows duplicate forms after switching between tabs

fields.description:
When trying to merge a pull request that has a conflict, you will receive a popup:

"You can't merge until this pull request meets the following conditions:"

This message is too ambiguous.. we should be more specific on where the conflict is to avoid confusion.
fields.summary: Merge checklist error message is ambiguous when file conflict is involved

fields.description:
Hi,\\
could you please delete the failed import repos

https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/1201237\\
https://bitbucket.org/repo/import/1200319

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Import Fail, please delete repo

fields.description:
When forking a Mercurial repo in https://bitbucket.org, users can specify which revision to fork at. Currently, this is not available for Git repositories.

Users would like to be able to fork Git repositories at a specific commit as well.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to fork a Git repo at any commit

fields.description: I would love to be able to see the UI filled out when using a monitor in the vertical position.  Seems like the UI should be responsive to this setup.
fields.summary: Extend UI for Portrait Mode Monitor

fields.description:
For example, the first Google search hit for "launchbox bitbucket" is the submit new issues page of the repository.

This would cause users to many submit reports without checking existing open issue first.\\
Hence, it's best that the issue page is indexed instead of the "new issue creation" page.
fields.summary: Hide "New Issue" pages from search engine bots

fields.description:
!310078829-%D0%A1%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%BC%D0%BE%D0%BA%20%D1%8D%D0%BA%D1%80%D0%B0%D0%BD%D0%B0%20%D0%BE%D1%82%202017-05-24%2014-04-42.png|thumbnail!

Hello! These link appear instead {{@param}} and {{@return}}.\\
I think it doesn't good thing.
fields.summary: Strange links in markdown documents
